name: methanol factory construction | methanol factory | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/567/documentation

Methanol plant with a daly production of 2700 t methanol. Life time of plant assumed with 30 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Requirements for materials for the infrastructure. Estimates on energy use for construction. Transport of materials to construction site. Dismatnteling of plant and disposal. Land useand occupation for plant.
category: F:Construction/41:Construction of buildings/410:Construction of buildings/4100:Construction of buildings

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Estimated data refers on a new plant built in Sibiria. Land use consideredwith different plant sites from different regions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Plant with modern design asessed.  Only materials included but no production of the parts. Estimates for the energy used in building and dismantling.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Infrastructure data from one plant applied for the whole production. Therefore higher uncertainity. Land use asessed and extrapolated with average data from different plants. This value has a large range, so the uncertainity of the value is still high.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Infrastructure data obtained from literature. Land use data from literature and porject data for recently built plants.
